title: Cognitive Load Theory-Based Remote Interactive Multimedia Learning Design

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental digital literacy and intermediate or higher expertise in specialized fields (medical/legal/technical)
context.additional_context: A course that strengthens multimedia content design skills for remote education while maintaining offline classroom instruction in a BYOD environment.

learning_goals: Learners can apply cognitive load theory to design visual-auditory integration strategies for interactive distance education content
Learners can understand principles of decomposing complex professional social field content into chunks and develop multi-stage interactive scenarios
Learners can diagnose and adjust cognitive load levels of multimedia materials using formative assessment tools
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
